name: A3F
shortDescription: This extension adds features to the built-in 3D.

Overlay the object on the 3D object.
âš ï¸ For objects to overlap correctly, they must be on a different layer than the 3D object. In the layer properties, the 'Default camera behavior' under 'Camera positioning' must be set to 'Keep top-left corner fixed'.

eventsFunctions.description:
The axis helper is added to the 3D object.
Note that it is added to the center point, not the origin point.
eventsFunctions.name: AddAxesHelper

eventsFunctions.description:

Change the blend mode of the 3D objects and all their children.
This affects all 3d objects that use the same material.

Change the blend mode of the 3D objects and all their children.
This affects all 3d objects that use the same material.

parameters.description: Make the material unique to this object
parameters.longDescription: If No, it will affect all 3D objects that use the same material.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the opacity of the 3D object, or the first opacity found among its children.
eventsFunctions.name: Opacity

eventsFunctions.description:
Check the opacity of the 3D object, or the first opacity found among its children.
This condition can be used for non-3D objects as well, but in those cases the opacity is always compared as 255.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckOpacity

eventsFunctions.description:
Change the shadow settings of 3D objects.
If both "Cast Shadow" and "Receive Shadow" are enabled, striped patterns are likely to occur in the shadow.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeShadow

eventsFunctions.description: Checks the distance between two objects (origin points) in 3D.
eventsFunctions.fullName: â†”ï¸Check the distance between two objects in 3D
eventsFunctions.name: CheckDistance

eventsFunctions.description:
Outputs the hierarchy of the 3D object's children to the console.
It is recommended to check in the developer tools console, where line breaks and indentation are displayed, rather than in GDevelop's debugger console.
Use the following shortcut in the preview window to open the Developer Tools and select the Console tab:
Ctrl + Shift + I (Cmd + Option + I).
eventsFunctions.name: OutputHierarchy

eventsFunctions.description:
Linearly interpolates 3D objects toward a child of another 3D object.
The names of the children must be checked in advance using the "ðŸ›ŸOutput children hierarchy" action or a 3D modeling tool.
eventsFunctions.fullName: ðŸ”œLinearly interpolate toward child of 3D object (Experimental)
eventsFunctions.name: LerpTowardChild
eventsFunctions.sentence: ðŸ”œLinearly interpolate toward child (_PARAM1_, Target: _PARAM3_, Child: _PARAM5_, Position: _PARAM6_, Rotation: _PARAM7_)

inlineCode: const ObjectPosition = new THREE.Vector3(Object2D.getX(), Object2D.getY(), Object2D.getZ());

eventsFunctions.description:
Rotate a child of the 3D objects along its local axes.
The names of the children must be checked in advance using the "ðŸ›ŸOutput children hierarchy" action or a 3D modeling tool.
This can also be used to rotate bones.
Note that if a child is affected by a playing animation, it will override this change. In that case, please pause the animation.
eventsFunctions.name: ChildRotateAngle

eventsFunctions.description:
Rotate a child of the 3D objects along its local axes.
The names of the children must be checked in advance using the "ðŸ›ŸOutput children hierarchy" action or a 3D modeling tool.
This can also be used to rotate bones.
Note that if a child is affected by a playing animation, it will override this change. In that case, please pause the animation.
eventsFunctions.name: ChildRotateSpeed

eventsFunctions.description:
Changes the angle of the 3D object's child along the childâ€™s local axes.
The names of the children must be checked in advance using the "ðŸ›ŸOutput children hierarchy" action or a 3D modeling tool.
This can also be used to rotate bones.
Note that if a child is affected by a playing animation, it will override this change. In that case, please pause the animation.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeChildAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: ðŸ”„ï¸Change child angle (_PARAM1_, Child: _PARAM3_, X: _PARAM4_ Y: _PARAM5_ Z: _PARAM6_)

eventsFunctions.description:
Outputs the morph target names of the 3D object to the console.
It is recommended to check in the developer tools console, where line breaks and indentation are displayed, rather than in GDevelop's debugger console.
Use the following shortcut in the preview window to open the Developer Tools and select the Console tab:
Ctrl + Shift + I (Cmd + Option + I).
eventsFunctions.name: OutputMorphTarget

eventsFunctions.description:
Change morph target values of 3D models.
The names of the morph target must be checked in advance using the "ðŸ›ŸOutput morph target names" action or a 3D modeling tool.
Note that if a morph target is affected by a playing animation, it will override this change. In that case, please pause the animation.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeMorphTarget
eventsFunctions.sentence: ðŸ˜€Change morph target value (_PARAM1_, Morph: _PARAM3_, _PARAM4_, Value: _PARAM5_)

eventsFunctions.description:
Sets all morph target values of the 3D object to 0.
Note that if a morph target is affected by a playing animation, it will override this change. In that case, please pause the animation.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetMorphTargets

eventsFunctions.description:
Stores the normalized direction vector of the 3D object in a variable.
The variable will be a structure variable with child variables x, y, and z.
Note that the variable will only store the value of the first referenced 3D object.
eventsFunctions.name: NormalizedDirection
eventsFunctions.sentence: â†—ï¸Store normalized direction in variable (_PARAM1_, Axis: _PARAM3_, Variable: _PARAM4_)

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Use this when you want to set the initial properties of a 3D object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: A3I

propertyDescriptors.label: Blend mode
propertyDescriptors.description: This affects all 3d objects that use the same material.
propertyDescriptors.name: Blend

propertyDescriptors.label: Opacity (0 to 255)
propertyDescriptors.description: This affects all 3d objects that use the same material.
propertyDescriptors.name: Opacity

propertyDescriptors.label: Cast Shadow
propertyDescriptors.description: If both "Cast Shadow" and "Receive Shadow" are enabled, striped patterns are likely to occur in the shadow.
propertyDescriptors.name: CastShadow

propertyDescriptors.label: Receive Shadow
propertyDescriptors.description: If both "Cast Shadow" and "Receive Shadow" are enabled, striped patterns are likely to occur in the shadow.
propertyDescriptors.name: ReceiveShadow

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: âš ï¸ 3D Lights are highly loaded.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: A3L

Light = new THREE.SpotLight(`rgb(${RGB[0]}, ${RGB[1]}, ${RGB[2]})`, Intensity, Distance, gdjs.toRad(SpotAngle), SpotPenumbra, Decay);

Light = new THREE.PointLight(`rgb(${RGB[0]}, ${RGB[1]}, ${RGB[2]})`, Intensity, Distance, Decay);

eventsFunctions.description: Gradually changes the color of the 3D Light.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeColor
eventsFunctions.sentence: ðŸ’¡Change Light Color (_PARAM0_, Color: _PARAM2_, Duration: _PARAM3_, Space: _PARAM4_)

parameters.longDescription: If the duration is set to 0, the change is immediate.
parameters.name: Duration

eventsFunctions.description: Gradually changes the intensity of the 3D Light.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeIntensity

parameters.longDescription: If the duration is set to 0, the change is immediate.
parameters.name: Duration

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance (Default: 0)
propertyDescriptors.description: For Point and Spot Lights. 0 is no limit.
propertyDescriptors.name: Distance

propertyDescriptors.label: Spot Angle (0 to 180)
propertyDescriptors.description: For Spot Lights. The narrower the angle, the better the shadow quality. If it is a multiple of 90, the shadow will not be cast correctly.
propertyDescriptors.name: SpotAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Cast Shadow
propertyDescriptors.description: âš ï¸ This is expensive and requires tweaking to get shadows looking right.
propertyDescriptors.name: CastShadow

propertyDescriptors.label: Shadow Map Size
propertyDescriptors.description: The larger the map, the better the shadow quality, but the greater the load.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowMapSize

propertyDescriptors.label: Range to Draw Shadows
propertyDescriptors.description: The smaller the range, the better the shadow quality. For Point and Spot Lights, this value is valid only if the Distance is 0.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowRange

propertyDescriptors.label: Shadow Depth Bias (Default: 0)
propertyDescriptors.description: It is mainly effective for filling gaps between objects and shadows. Reference value: [Directional Light: 0.002] [Point Light: 0.001] [Spot Light: 0.00001]
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowDepthBias

propertyDescriptors.label: Shadow Normal Bias (Default: 0)
propertyDescriptors.description: It is mainly effective in reducing striped patterns. Reference value: [Directional Light: 2] [Point Light: 1] [Spot Light: 1]
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowNormalBias
